intro: Alchornea nemoralis var. janeirensis, commonly known as the Brazilian nettle or false nettle, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves with a velvety texture. The plant produces small, greenish flowers arranged in clusters, and it is often found in moist, shaded environments. It has a fibrous root system and is adapted to thrive in tropical and subtropical climates. Its leaves are sometimes used in traditional medicine for their potential therapeutic properties.
